intro: Elsholtzia fruticosa var. paucidentata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved elsholtzia, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of central and southern China. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features aromatic, gray-green leaves with a distinctive narrow, lance-shaped form. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Its drought tolerance and ornamental value make it a popular choice among horticulturists and garden enthusiasts.
